content:
(For the special case of a straight wire, this force is zero.)
(d) Yes.

The average of the charge in the system may be zero.

Yet, the mean of the magnetic moments due to various current loops may not be zero.

We will come across such examples in connection with paramagnetic material where atoms have net dipole moment through their net charge is zero.
summary: This force on a moving charge due to a magnetic field is zero if the charge is stationary.
hypothetical_questions: What is the force on a moving charge due to a magnetic field?
When is the force on a charge due to a magnetic field zero?
How does a magnetic field affect the motion of charged particles?
What does it mean for a force to be zero?
